page.title: 10Reediehill Deer Farm
page.content: Mr and Mrs John Fletcher started up the first{Deer Farm}in Britain.The farm started up in 1974.There are two people working on the farm.Mr Fletcher hardly works on the farm as he is giving advice to other{Deer Farmers.} The Fletchers originally started off with{22 deer}from the{Isle of Rhum.} They now have{60 stags, 70 hinds}and{ {200 young}which is approximately{330 {deer}altogether.In the{winter}the{deer are{housed}in{big sheds.}They feed on {hay, silage}and{potatoes. Pea_straw}is also used in winter for{food}and{ {bedding.}Usually each{hind}has one {calf.95%}of these survive.The cost of a{deer}ranges from{Â£100}for a{calf}to{ {Â£600}for a{breeding stag.} Most of the{venison}is sold at the{ {farm shop}but some goes to hotels and the butcher's.
